item.title: Stay vigilant against banned organisations, DMP Commissioner asks officers
item.description: Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) Commissioner Sazzat Ali asked all officers to strictly follow the code of conduct and remain vigilant against any activities by banned organisations that could disrupt the electoral environment. “Violations of the electoral code of conduct could jeopardise the

item.title: Islami Bank holds board meeting on Wednesday
item.description: A meeting of the board of directors of Islami Bank Bangladesh PLC was held on Wednesday at Islami Bank Tower, according to a press release. Professor Dr. M. Zubaidur Rahman, chairman of the bank, presided over the meeting. Mohammad Khurshid Wahab, chairman of the executive committee, Md. Abdus Sal

item.title: Lawyer moves HC to suspend Bangladesh election until recovery of looted firearms
item.description: A Supreme Court lawyer has filed a public interest petition in the High Court seeking suspension of the national election until thousands of firearms looted during last year’s uprising are recovered. Lawyer Md Mahmudul Hasan lodged the writ petition on Wednesday, naming the cabinet secretary

item.title: EC approves 73 more appeals on 5th day
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) on Wednesday approved 73 more appeals on the fifth day against the order of acceptance and cancellation of nomination papers of the Returning Officers in the upcoming 13th national elections. EC Secretariat Senior Secretary Akhtar Ahmed told reporters this evening that

item.title: BRAC Bank, MetLife Bangladesh reward Bancassurance campaign winners with Bangkok trips
item.description: BRAC Bank has recognised the top performers of its bancassurance campaign, ‘Fly Bangkok with Banca’, conducted in strategic partnership with MetLife Bangladesh, according to a press release. The campaign marked another significant milestone in BRAC Bank’s expanding bancassurance

item.title: BPC seeks LPG import rights
item.description: The Bangladesh Petroleum Corporation (BPC) has formally requested permission from the Energy and Mineral Resources Division to import liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) directly, aiming to tackle a domestic supply crisis and price volatility. In a letter addressed to the division’s secretary on J

item.title: Bank Asia, Bangladesh Bank organise training for SME entrepreneurs in Sylhet
item.description: Bank Asia PLC, in association with Bangladesh Bank, has organized a month-long ‘Entrepreneurship Development Program’ for SME entrepreneurs in Sylhet, according to a press release. The program was inaugurated on 12 January 2026 by the Chief Guest Mr. Khaled Ahmed, Executive Director, B

item.title: FBCCI organises doa mahfil for seeking eternal peace of Khaleda Zia
item.description: The Federation of Bangladesh Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FBCCI) on Wednesday organized a doa mahfil for seeking eternal peace of the departed soul of former Prime Minister Begum Khaleda Zia. The milad mahfil, which took place at the FBCCI Auditorium following the Asr prayer, was

item.title: UAE rulers grant royal pardons to 440 Bangladeshi prisoners
item.description: The rulers of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) have granted royal pardons to 440 Bangladeshi prisoners, said the UAE Embassy in Dhaka on Wednesday. The royal pardons were granted on the occasion of the 54th UAE National Day (Eid Al Etihad) in 2025, which is observed annually on December 2, commemora

item.title: Bangladesh receives $1.59b in remittances in first 13 days of Jan
item.description: The upward trend in remittances sent by Bangladesh expatriates has continued in January, with receiving over US $1.59 billion in 13 days of the month. Bangladesh received $17.85 billion in inward remittances from July to January 13, 2026, in the current fiscal year, FY 2025-26. It was 14.7 billion

item.title: Iran warns of retaliation if Trump strikes, US withdraws some troops from regional bases
item.description: The United States is withdrawing some personnel from bases in the Middle East, a US official said on Wednesday, after a senior Iranian official said Tehran had warned neighbours it would hit American bases if Washington strikes. item.title: EC clarifies viral video of postal ballots in Bahrain
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) on Wednesday clarified a viral video showing a large number of postal ballots delivered to a single address in Bahrain, saying the incident resulted from differences in the country’s postal delivery system and did not involve any irregularities in the voting proce
